title: Sans Serif Logotype
content:
I think this might be customized. But still would like to know what typeface is the base.

The O looks like Gotham but the S is definitely not. the S to me looks like Helvetica but customized the terminals.

Any thoughts? Thank you!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150219021454im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Populous_Logo_-02_6385.png)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Populous\_Logo\_-02.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150219021454/http:/typophile.com/files/Populous_Logo_-02.png) | 38.68 KB |
author: cewang999

comments.content:
\_S\_ looks distorted by horizontal stretching.  
Don

Coop Expanded by Dalton Maag is very close, but I can’t find a source for it:  
 [http://www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=DaltonMaag%2...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150219021454/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=DaltonMaag%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=CoopExpanded%20-%20Bold&fstyle=&fsize=60&fid=3a3542cc69c0278b911f503154af9c92&wrap=2&text=POPULOUS "http://www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=DaltonMaag%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=CoopExpanded%20-%20Bold&fstyle=&fsize=60&fid=3a3542cc69c0278b911f503154af9c92&wrap=2&text=POPULOUS")

Isn’t Coop an House Ind. thing ( [http://www.houseind.com/fonts/typographyofcoop](http://web.archive.org/web/20150219021454/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/typographyofcoop "http://www.houseind.com/fonts/typographyofcoop"))? Maybe DaMa changed the name.

[Populous website](http://web.archive.org/web/20150219021454/http:/populous.com/) uses [Proxima Nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20150219021454/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/proxima-nova), a good match for all letters except /S (obvious) which actually reminds me a lot of... [Arial](http://web.archive.org/web/20150219021454/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/arial) (closer look to /S Extra Bold [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150219021454/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/arial/std-extra-bold/glyphs.html#glyphs/542187/52)). And Arial is also used on their website... Coincidence?  
Ready-to-go option: [Union](http://web.archive.org/web/20150219021454/http:/www.radimpesko.com/fonts/union)
Thanks for these great thoughts! It just occurred to me that the R in the trademark looks like Gotham. Seems like this logo is done by more than one person?

> It just occurred to me that the R in the trademark looks like Gotham.

... or Proxima Nova and you should end up with 2 fonts only :)
